title: Adele to star in televised concert special, 'An Audience With Adele,' following release of new album
description: Adele is not going easy on her fans, with the singer starring in a highly anticipated televised UK concert special on Sunday following the release of her new album, "30."

title: Opinion: Where Xi's China is heading
description: Imagine, for a moment, what the world looks like to people living in China today — say, to an average couple.

title: An accidental weapon discharge at Atlanta airport caused panic and halted flights
description: The accidental discharge of a weapon near the main screening area of Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport caused widespread panic Saturday afternoon, prompting a brief halt of departing flights over the busy travel weekend.

title: Exploring mysterious worlds in 'The Hunt for Planet B'
description: If the universe is a seemingly endless desert, planet Earth is just a grain of sand.

title: Rolls-Royce claims to have developed the world's fastest all-electric aircraft
description: British aero engine manufacturer Rolls-Royce says it has developed the "world's fastest all-electric aircraft," according to a statement from the company.

title: Queen marks first wedding anniversary without Prince Philip
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has reached her first wedding anniversary since the death of her husband, Prince Philip.

title: Chinese state media shares video clips purporting to show tennis star Peng Shuai
Make Chile great again? Meet the far-right presidential candidate tempting voters from Chile's left and center
description: "This is the first time I will vote for a right-wing candidate. I consider myself a leftist, but today I am 100% sure I will go for José Antonio Kast," said Rodrigo Álvarez, a 48-old sociologist and public administrator, referring to Chile's far right presidential candidate, a long-time conservative politician and defender of former dictator Augusto Pinochet's regime.

title: VP Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff become first to affix a mezuzah on executive home
description: Vice President Kamala Harris and her husband Doug Emhoff achieved another first in their historic roles when they affixed a white mezuzah to the right-hand side of the doorway of the vice presidential residence.

title: Nigerian musician Davido says he will give $600,000 to charity after online appeal
description: Nigerian-American musician Davido has announced he will donate more than $600,000 to orphanages across Nigeria, after hosting an impromptu online appeal that initially sparked amusement and confusion from his fans.

title: Two years after Notre Dame, fire breaks out near another Paris landmark
description: A large fire broke out in a building on boulevard des Capucines, near the Place de L'Opera square in central Paris on Saturday, sending clouds of smoke rising into the air.

title: Lewis Hamilton praised for defending LGBTI rights during F1 Qatar Grand Prix
description: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton has been widely praised after showing his support for the LGBTI community during a practice session Friday for the Qatar Grand Prix.

title: Pillow fighting enters combat sports arena
description: Pillow fighting is moving out of the bedroom and into the boxing ring when Pillow Fight Championship (PFC) holds its first live, pay-per-view event in Florida on Jan. 29.

title: Usain Bolt: 'I try to stay away as much as possible' from social media
description: As athletes grapple with the pros and cons of using social media, Usain Bolt says he has the utmost sympathy for them as he recalled the way he was treated as a young athlete.

title: When granted a 'Make-A-Wish,' this 13-year-old chose to feed his city's homeless for a year
description: When Adeola "Abraham" Olagbegi discovered his bone marrow transplant was successful, he was granted any wish of his choice.

title: South American football hopes to emerge from pandemic with 3 club finals in 8 days
description: With the 2020 editions of the biggest football matches in South America postponed and played in front of a handful of fans due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this year's upcoming tournament finals are promising a different look by bringing supporters back in the stands.

title: 'We're expecting Novak to come': Players must be vaccinated to play in Australian Open
description: Players will have to be fully vaccinated to participate in the upcoming Australian Open, with Tennis Australia Chief Executive Officer Craig Tiley hopeful that men's world No. 1 Novak Djokovic will be competing.

title: Europe's painful lesson: For now, a high vaccination rate isn't enough to stop Covid
Alpine country goes back into lockdown, suspending tourism
description: Austria has introduced unprecedented new Covid measures, Ireland's under a midnight curfew, but India has reopened to vaccinated tourists.

title: The EU realizes it can't rely on America for protection. Now it has a blueprint for a new joint military force
description: The chaos at the border between Poland and Belarus is just the latest incident to get top brass in Brussels pondering what the European Union should do long-term about its internal security.

title: They just moved to the US and wanted to experience their first Thanksgiving. More than 100 strangers responded with help
description: For many, Thanksgiving involves traveling to spend time with family and loved ones around the dinner table eating turkey and green bean casserole. It's a time to watch football and reflect on everything you're thankful for.

title: ICC prosecutor suspends probe into Philippines drugs war
description: The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) has suspended a probe at Manila's request into suspected rights abuses during Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's crackdown on drugs.

title: Here's why legal experts say Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted
She's helped dozens of child brides out of their marriages. It's work that has risk
description: The Child Marriage Restraint Act (CMRA) of 1929 set out to "eradicate the evil of child marriage" in India. Almost a century later, the south Asian nation remains home to a third of the world's child brides.

title: How Azeem Rafiq's testimony on racist abuse shines light on cricket's deep-rooted problems
description: "From early on there was a lot of, 'You lot sit over there near the toilets,' the word 'P***' was used constantly, no one ever stamped it out," said former cricketer Azeem Rafiq as he laid bare this week his experience of racial abuse at one of England's top clubs.

title: New lawsuit filed on behalf of more than 280 Astroworld Festival concertgoers
description: A new lawsuit has been filed on behalf of more than 280 Astroworld Festival concertgoers, the Thomas J. Henry Law firm announced in a news release Thursday.

title: Asia's intensifying arms race could lead to war, analysts warn
description: In Shanghai's sprawling Jiangnan Shipyard, workers are fitting the catapults that will separate China's latest and most advanced aircraft carrier from its two outdated sister ships.

title: Paul Rudd finally revealed how he stays looking young
description: Paul Rudd, the ageless and newly named Sexiest Man Alive, says his secret to looking young involves a few tricks and ABBA.

title: Biden's first physical in office explains his frequent throat clearing and stiff walk
